alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 7:34PM PDT until August 04 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY... At 734 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicates that over the past hour thunderstorm activity has decreased in both coverage and intensity. However, between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen and runoff from the storms will still be capable of producing flash flooding in the warned area. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Panaca and Cathedral Gorge State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
